definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine

sentences.english: They've already implanted electrodes into blind patients on a temporary basis, allowing them to see flashes of light.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經爲盲者植入暫時的義眼，讓他們能看到閃光。

sentences.english: He was snapped making sure the windows were sparkling by a resident in a neighbouring apartment block.
sentences.chinese: 他煩惱一定是鄰近公寓樓的住戶讓窗玻璃發出閃光。

sentences.english: Xenon lamp IR energy is ideal for flash fusing toner.
sentences.chinese: 氙燈紅外能量是理想的閃光融合碳粉。

sentences.english: Alec Su's eyes glistens as he talks.
sentences.chinese: 當蘇有朋說的時候，他的眼睛在閃光。

sentences.english: The coffee plant is really a small tree with shiny leaves.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡這種植物其實是一種有着閃光的葉子的矮樹。

sentences.english: On cloudy days, use the camera's fill-flash mode if it has one.
sentences.chinese: 在陰天，如果相機有充分閃光模式，則可使用該模式。

sentences.english: I will continue my future, although ordinary, but try flash look.
sentences.chinese: 我還要續寫我未來，雖然平凡，但盡閃光望。

sentences.english: When the camera's flash went off, the tiger roared and disappeared, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他說當他的相機閃光燈閃起時，老虎吼叫着消失了。

sentences.english: After a flash, Marjorie vanished from the frame.
sentences.chinese: 一片閃光之後，馬約莉便從圖像中消失了。

sentences.english: Opals could be brilliant because they have tiny crystals which could scatter light.
sentences.chinese: 蛋白石閃光是因爲有小的水晶顆粒可以反射光。

sentences.english: This is my advice. Give a glittering scale to each of the other fish.
sentences.chinese: 我建議你把你的閃光鱗，分給每條魚一片。

sentences.english: The built-in LED flash does double duty.
sentences.chinese: 在LED閃光燈內置有雙重的責任。

sentences.english: The flashes of intuition were nonrational.
sentences.chinese: 直覺的閃光是非理性的。

sentences.english: Another tell-tale sign of misused on-camera flash is the dark tunnel effect.
sentences.chinese: 另一個濫用機頂閃光燈的典型是黑色背景效果。

sentences.english: A great way to break up the classic black party dress is to add shine.
sentences.chinese: 打破老派黑色派對裝魔咒的一大法寶就是增加閃光點。

sentences.english: But they have a pretty bad safety record.
sentences.chinese: 但是閃光彈有一個極其不良的安全記錄。

definition: to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
to hide/to conceal/to mask/to shelter/to harbor (i.e. keep sth hidden)/to hide oneself/to lie low/to nestle/hidden/implicit/private/covert/recessed (lighting)
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
